poem:
**Second Glance**

The arm tells its story,  
lines hidden in plain sight;  
beneath laughter's surface,  
shadows twist in the light.  
Trust missteps, a danced false   
around the sun's glare.  
Yet in the re-look, a careful stitch  
recalls what doctors miss,  
life sketches itself once more  
on skin's uncertain page.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Comedian Katherine Ryan reveals second skin cancer diagnosis The comedian Katherine Ryan has received a second skin cancer diagnosis after raising concerns about a mole on her arm. Ryan attended a private clinic where a doctor who also works for the NHS dismissed her concerns about melanoma and gave her the all-clear, but she went back and a test revealed the mole was cancerous. The 41-year-old standup was diagnosed with stage two melanoma in her". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
